intro: Perityle greenei, commonly known as the Greene's perityle, is a rare flowering plant native to the Sierra Nevada mountains of California. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family, characterized by its bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils at high elevations. It produces small, pale blue to purple flowers during the summer months. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Perityle greenei is considered a vulnerable species.
